MemberSignature.Value: static member CompareMimeTypes : string * string -> bool
public static bool CompareMimeTypes (string? concreteType, string? desiredType);
.method public static hidebysig bool CompareMimeTypes(string concreteType, string desiredType) cil managed

Docs.param: A desired MIME type that may be a pattern such as */*.
Docs.summary: Helper to compare two MIME types, where one may be a pattern.
Docs.returns: Returns true if the two MIME types match.

MemberSignature.Value: abstract member FilterMimeTypes : string -> string[] override this.FilterMimeTypes : string -> string[]
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string[] FilterMimeTypes(string mimeType) cil managed

Docs.param: The desired MIME type. May be a pattern.
Docs.summary: Filter the clip description MIME types by the given MIME type.
Docs.returns: Returns an array of all matching MIME types. If there are no matching MIME types, null is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance float32 GetConfidenceScore(string entity) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a score indicating confidence that an instance of the given entity is present in the first item of the clip data, if that item is plain text and text classification has been performed.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: abstract member HasMimeType : string -> bool override this.HasMimeType : string -> bool
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool HasMimeType(string mimeType) cil managed

Docs.param: The desired MIME type. May be a pattern.
Docs.summary: Check whether the clip description contains the given MIME type.
Docs.returns: Returns true if one of the MIME types in the clip description matches the desired MIME type, else false.

Docs.summary: Return the timestamp at which the associated ClipData is copied to global clipboard in the System#currentTimeMillis() time base.
Docs.value: timestamp at which the associated ClipData is copied to global clipboard or 0 if it is not copied to clipboard.
